meanings.definition: To store or house (an aircraft) in a hangar.
meanings.sent1: The small plane was hangared safely during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The pilot always hangared his aircraft after each flight.
meanings.sent3: The birds were jealous of the plane being hangared away from the rain.
meanings.sent4: She hangared her worries and fears, finding solace in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic hangared the vintage plane with great care and attention.

meanings.sent1: The hangared of the aircraft was spacious and well-equipped.
meanings.sent2: The old hangared was converted into a museum showcasing aviation history.
meanings.sent3: The hangared reminded him of the adventures he had in the air.
meanings.sent4: In his dreams, the hangared became a portal to different worlds.
meanings.sent5: The hangared was a sanctuary for the pilot, a place of peace and reflection.
